posts.title: Delhi records over 500 new COVID-19 cases, 50 deaths; positivity rate at 0.68%
posts.content: Delhi on Friday registered a slight uptick in the daily COVID-19 cases with 523 new infections in the last 24 hours, as compared to 487 infections reported on Thursday. The daily positivity rate in Delhi on Friday was 0.68% as compared to 0.61% on Thursday. As many as 50 more COVID-19 related deaths were reported in Delhi on Friday.
posts.author: Sakshita Khosla

posts.title: Yami Gautam gets married to 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar, shares pic
posts.content: Actress Yami Gautam took to social media on Friday to reveal that she got married to 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar. "With the blessings of our family, we have tied the knot in an intimate wedding ceremony today," she wrote. "Being very private people, we celebrated this joyous occasion with our immediate family," Yami added.
posts.author: Daisy Mowke

posts.title: Indian-origin photographer's optical illusion pic of orangutan wins ₹1.5L cash prize
posts.content: Thomas Vijayan won Nature TTL Photographer of the Year 2021. Vijayan, hailing from Kerala and now settled in Canada, shot the picture titled 'The World is Going Upside Down', in Borneo. "I selected a tree that was in water...The water formed a mirror...Then I climbed...the tree and waited for hours," said Vijayan, who got £1,500 (₹1.5 lakh) cash prize.
posts.author: Daisy Mowke

posts.title: Gautam Gambhir to organise 1-month free COVID-19 vaccination camps
posts.content: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir has said that his foundation will organise a month long free COVID-19 vaccination camps. Taking to Twitter, Gambhir wrote, "Delhi doesn't need blame game, it needs intent." This comes a day after the Delhi High Court was told by the drug controller that Gambhir's foundation had unauthorisedly procured high quantity of Fabiflu for distribution.
posts.author: Ridham Gambhir

posts.title: 9-yr-old lioness dies of suspected coronavirus infection in Chennai; 8 lions infected
posts.content: A nine-year-old lioness, Neela, has died in Chennai's Arignar Anna Zoological Park, days after testing positive for coronavirus with eight other lions. "The lioness had been asymptomatic and showed some nasal discharge only the day before," the zoo said. The zoo authorities said they have sent the samples again for testing to rule out possibility of a false positive report.
posts.author: Arshiya Chopra

posts.title: Ensure parental property of kids orphaned by COVID isn't sold: Govt to states
posts.content: The Ministry of Women and Child Development has written to state governments mentioning guidelines to handle children orphaned by COVID-19. The letter states that the children shouldn't be exploited financially which includes that their ancestral property isn't sold. Among other norms, it also mentions that the grants received by child should only be used for his/her education and welfare.
posts.author: Ridham Gambhir

posts.title: Govt releases state-wise distribution of COVID-19 cases in India
posts.content: The government on Friday released state-wise distribution of COVID-19 cases in India, naming 12 states/UTs that have 1 lakh or less confirmed coronavirus cases. There are 13 states/UTs, including Odisha, Telangana and Uttarakhand, that have confirmed cases between 1 lakh and 8 lakh. Meanwhile, 11 states/UTs like Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi have more than 8 lakh total coronavirus cases.
posts.author: Arshiya Chopra

posts.title: India overtook US in terms of number of people who got at least 1 vaccine dose: Govt
posts.content: India has overtaken the US in terms of the number of people who have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul said on Friday. As of Thursday (June 3), India administered 17.2 crore vaccine doses as compared to 16.9 crore doses administered in US and 3.9 crore doses in UK, he said.
posts.author: Sakshita Khosla

posts.title: Russian player arrested at French Open amid match-fixing investigation
posts.content: Russian tennis player Yana Sizikova has reportedly been arrested at the French Open amid allegations of match-fixing in last year's tournament. An investigation was reportedly opened last October after Sizikova and her partner Madison Brengle were defeated in the first round of women's doubles in the tournament. Sizikova also lost in the first round of women's doubles this year.
posts.author: Ankur Taliyan

posts.title: HDFC Bank retracts crypto warning after RBI says its 2018 circular is not valid
posts.content: HDFC Bank retracted an email sent to customers late last week, which warned them about dealing in cryptocurrency transactions citing a 2018 order from RBI that was struck down by the Supreme Court last year. This comes after RBI issued a clarification on May 31 that its 2018 order was not valid and can't be cited.
posts.author: Arshiya Chopra

posts.title: Govt clears ₹43,000 cr project to build 6 high-tech submarines in India
posts.content: The Ministry of Defence on Friday said it has cleared a project to domestically build six conventional submarines equipped with state-of-the-art technology at a cost of around ₹43,000 crore. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the project's approval by the Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) was a "landmark approval", adding, "This would be one of the largest 'Make in India' projects".
posts.author: Sakshita Khosla

posts.title: Salary, pension can be credited via NACH even on bank holidays from Aug 1: RBI policy
posts.content: The RBI has announced that the National Automated Clearing House (NACH), a bulk payment system operated by NPCI, will be available on all days of the week from August 1. This means that a bank holiday will no longer stop transfer of dividend, interest, salary and pension and collection of payments related to electricity, telephone and periodic instalments towards loans.
posts.author: Kiran Khatri

posts.title: Quit films because of ex-husband's conservative family: Pooja Bedi
posts.content: Pooja Bedi, during a conversation with Samir Soni, opened up about her exit from Bollywood. She said, "My ex-husband (Farhan Furniturewalla) told me, if I was going to get married, I couldn't continue in films because his family is very conservative." Pooja added, "So, to me, it was like, 'Okay, I'll give up this journey...and start a new one'."
posts.author: Udit Gupta

posts.title: Siddharth Pithani sent to 14-day judicial custody in drugs case
posts.content: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-flatmate Siddharth Pithani, who was recently arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), has been sent to 14-day judicial custody. He was arrested from Hyderabad in connection with the drugs case linked to Sushant's death. The agency has recently interrogated Neeraj and Keshav, the former domestic workers of the late actor.
posts.author: Udit Gupta

posts.title: Australia detects coronavirus variant first found in India
posts.content: Australia said it has detected the Delta variant of COVID-19 that was discovered in India for the first time in the outbreak in Melbourne. The Delta variant was detected in two members of a family. "The fact that it's a variant different to other cases it means it's not related, in terms of transmission, with these cases," an official said.
posts.author: Shailesh

posts.title: No active COVID-19 case in Pimpri-Chinchwad's Roseland: Society Chairman
posts.content: The Chairman of Roseland Housing Society, one of the largest societies in Pimpri-Chinchwad said that they don't have a single active COVID-19 case. In early May, there were 74 cases in the society. "An eight-bed isolation ward was readied...We had set up a testing camp," said Chairman Santosh Maskar, adding that a COVID-19 protection team was also set up.
posts.author: Navashree Nandini

posts.title: B'luru triage centres can now book hospital beds for COVID-19 patients
posts.content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) upgraded its portal where hospital beds can be allotted for patients walking into Physical Triaging Centres in Bengaluru. A total of 26 hospitals are mapped across all zones for beds. "BBMP plans to move towards mandatory physical triaging as a prerequisite for all patients seeking hospital admissions," a statement read.
posts.author: Christina George

posts.title: Antivirus software Norton 360 lets users mine Ethereum
posts.content: Some Norton 360 users have been given access to a new feature, Norton Crypto, which will allow them to mine Ethereum cryptocurrency. NortonLifeLock plans to expand the feature to all of its Norton 360 customers in the coming months. Customers will be able to track and transfer their earnings into a wallet.
posts.author: Aishwarya Awasthi

posts.title: Priyanka Vadra to bear my education expenses: Bihar's 'cycle girl'
posts.content: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday spoke to Bihar's 'cycle girl' Jyoti Kumari, who cycled 1,200 km from Gurugram to Bihar, and said that she would bear her education expenses. Priyanka Gandhi also expressed condolences on her father's demise. "Priyanka didi told me not to worry...I also told didi that I want to meet her," Jyoti Kumari said.
posts.author: Navashree Nandini

posts.title: Govt must ensure 1cr COVID-19 vaccinations per day: Goa Cong to Prez
posts.content: The Goa unit of Congress submitted a memorandum to President Ram Nath Kovind asking him to direct the Centre to ensure one crore COVID-19 vaccinations per day. The delegation led by Goa Pradesh Congress Committee chief Girish Chodankar submitted the memorandum through the Governor of Goa, BS Koshyari. "Vaccination is the only protection in...COVID-19 pandemic," the party wrote.
posts.author: Navashree Nandini

posts.title: Andhra CM's sister registers her party as 'YSR T'gana Party': Reports
posts.content: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's sister YS Sharmila registered her political party as 'YSR Telangana Party' on Thursday, as per reports. This comes months after Sharmila announced that she would officially launch her party on July 8. As per the reports, an application was submitted to the Election Commission of India to register her party.
posts.author: Navashree Nandini

posts.title: 2 minors booked for raping classmate in car after offering her ride
posts.content: Two minors have been booked for allegedly raping and assaulting their 17-year-old classmate in a car in Punjab, police said. The girl purportedly told her mother that she, along with her friend, was offered a ride by the accused. Her friend was eventually asked to get off. Later, the accused allegedly stopped the car and one of them raped her.
posts.author: Shreyasi Banerjee

posts.title: Birth rate in Japan falls to all-time low, marriages also decline
posts.content: The number of babies born in 2020 in Japan hit a record low amid coronavirus pandemic, Health Ministry said. The number of births fell to 840,832 in 2020, down 2.8% from 2019 and the lowest since records began in 1899. The number of marriages fell 12.3% last year to 525,490, lowest since the end of World War II, it added.
posts.author: Athira Sasidharan

posts.title: France suspends joint military operations with Mali over coup
posts.content: France said it'll suspend joint military operations with Mali in response to the West African country's second coup in nine months, "awaiting guarantees" that civilian rule will return. Colonel Assimi Goïta had seized power after detaining interim President Bah Ndaw last week. Earlier, the African Union and the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) had suspended Mali's membership.
posts.author: Shailesh
